response.content:
{
  "step1": "Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease and flour two 8-inch round cake pans. Gather ingredients: 1¾ cups all-purpose flour, ¾ cup unsweetened cocoa, 2 cups sugar, 1½ teaspoons baking powder, 1 teaspoon baking soda, ½ teaspoon salt. Set aside. All ingredients should be at room temperature for best results today.",
  "step2": "Combine the dry ingredients in a large bowl. Whisk together flour, cocoa powder, baking powder, baking soda, and salt until evenly mixed. Use a fine sieve to ensure no lumps. Gradually add powdered sugar, stirring continuously. This dry mix will form the cake's tender crumb and rich flavor foundation today.",
  "step3": "Beat 3 eggs at room temperature in a separate bowl. Add 1 cup whole milk, ½ cup vegetable oil, and 2 teaspoons vanilla extract. Whisk until frothy. Slowly pour the wet mixture into the dry batter, folding gently to combine. Avoid overmixing; the batter should be smooth and slightly glossy.",
  "step4": "Divide the batter evenly between the prepared pans, smoothing tops with a spatula. Tap pans lightly to release air bubbles. Bake for 30–35 minutes, checking doneness with a toothpick inserted in the center. It should come out clean or with a few moist crumbs. Remove and cool on wire racks.",
  "step5": "Whisk 1 cup butter until creamy. Gradually sift 3 cups powdered sugar, ½ cup cocoa powder, and a pinch of salt into the butter. Add ¼ cup heavy cream, 1 teaspoon vanilla, and ¼ cup milk. Beat until light and fluffy, adjusting consistency with additional cream or sugar as needed.",
  "step6": "Let cooled cakes rest for 10 minutes before removing pans. Place one layer on a plate, spread frosting evenly, then top with second layer. Decorate with chocolate shavings or berries. Slice with a clean knife, serve immediately, and enjoy a moist, velvety chocolate cake perfect for eight guests and smiles."
}
